A.title: A1 — Anxious
A.content: When you feel anxious and overwhelmed, pause, breathe, and remember that God is present in this very moment.

A.title: A2 — Ashamed After Relapse
A.content: Shame says you are your failure. Grace says you are still God’s child. Come back to Him, even if it is the hundredth time.

A.title: A3 — Angry
A.content: Anger is a signal, not a destiny. Let it point you toward what needs healing, then invite God into that space.

S.title: S1 — Tempted
S.content: Temptation always offers a shortcut. Remember what you truly want long-term, not just what looks good right now.

S.title: S2 — Money Is Tight
S.content: Scarcity screams, but the Kingdom whispers, ‘Seek first the King and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.’

S.title: S3 — Conflict at Home
S.content: When tension rises at home, slow your words and shorten your sentences. Ask the Holy Spirit to help you listen before you defend.

P.title: P1 — Daily Prayer Rhythm
P.content: Begin and end each day with a simple prayer: ‘Lord, align my thoughts, my words, and my actions with Your Kingdom today.’

P.title: P2 — Pray the Scriptures
P.content: Turn a verse into a conversation with God. Read it slowly, then answer Him honestly about how it touches your life.

P.title: P3 — Evening Check-In
P.content: Before bed, replay the day with the Lord. Celebrate where you walked in step with Him, and release where you missed it.
